programme.title: Opera
programme.desc: A hooded figure forces a young diva (Cristina Marsillach) to watch as he murders performers in a production of Verdi's opera "Macbeth."

programme.title: Uncle Sam
programme.desc: A Gulf War veteran rises from the dead to wreak vengeance upon unpatriotic residents of his hometown.

programme.title: Blood Feast
programme.desc: In Herschell Gordon Lewis' gruesome oddity, a demented caterer's insane plot would resurrect an ancient Egyptian deity.

programme.title: Uncle Sam
programme.desc: A Gulf War veteran rises from the dead to wreak vengeance upon unpatriotic residents of his hometown.

programme.title: Bloody Bites
programme.desc: A boy is pressured by his brother to play a game that is said to summon a ghost; a man has to survive the night after he hits a creature in the road.

programme.title: Bloody Bites
programme.sub-title: There's One Inside the House; The New Jerusalem '98
programme.desc: A monster hunter has to fight a creature in his own home; a journalist is taken captive by an isolationist cult and forced to film their last hours.

programme.title: Body Bags
programme.desc: Filmmaker John Carpenter introduces a trio of terror tales: "Unleaded," "Hair" and Tobe Hooper's "Baseball Man."

programme.title: Housebound
programme.desc: A would-be thief (Morgana O'Reilly) is remanded to the custody of her estranged mother (Rima Te Wiata), who turns out to be correct in her assertion that evil spirits are afoot in their family domicile.

programme.title: 7 Below
programme.desc: Stranded strangers (Val Kilmer, Luke Goss) stay in a house where a boy murdered his family 100 years earlier.

programme.title: When a Stranger Calls
programme.desc: A retired police detective (Charles Durning) hunts a deranged British seaman out to re-create a baby sitter's (Carol Kane) horror.
